geopolitics.title: Trump: China's Xi to Visit US 'Toward the End of the Year'
geopolitics.description: President Donald Trump has said he will host Chinese leader Xi Jinping at the White House late this year, as the world's top two economies look to reset ties marred by a roiling trade war.

geopolitics.title: D.C. lobbyists have been the biggest winners of Trump’s trade wars - The Washington Post
geopolitics.description: The biggest winner of a trade war is the swamp.

geopolitics.title: EU Escalates Oil Sanctions With Broad Ban on Shipping Services
geopolitics.description: The European Union is preparing to take a much bigger swing at Russia’s oil trade, and this time Brussels is aiming less at optics and more at the plumbing that actually keeps barrels moving.

geopolitics.title: Washington Targets Tankers Keeping Iranian Crude Moving
geopolitics.description: Washington moved to tighten the screws on Iran’s oil trade again on Friday, rolling out a fresh batch of sanctions aimed squarely at the shadow fleet that keeps Tehran’s barrels moving when they’re not supposed to be.

geopolitics.title: EU mulls sanctions on Russia amid Ukraine war
geopolitics.description: The European Commission is weighing energy, financial services and trade sanctions against Russia as the Ukraine war enters its fifth year.

geopolitics.title: EU commission proposes further sanctions on Russian oil trade and financial services
geopolitics.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — The European Union's executive arm proposed further sanctions against Russia on Friday over the Ukraine war, including a ban on shipping…

geopolitics.title: EU commission proposes further sanctions on Russia
geopolitics.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen says the EU should ban maritime services aiding Russia in shipping oil and target its financial and trade sectors with new sanctions over the war on Ukraine.

geopolitics.title: EU Proposes Russian Maritime Services Ban to Hit Oil Trade (1)
geopolitics.description: The European Union proposed new sanctions that would replace a price cap on Russian oil with a full ban on maritime services, while also barring imports of some metals, chemicals and critical minerals.

crypto.title: Super Bowl Hot Take: Coinbase Karaoke Falls Flat
crypto.description: The ad, the first since its infamous 2022 spot, says nothing about the brand or its product—just as cryptocurrency could most use a cheerleader

crypto.title: Gold, Silver, Bitcoin Gain, While Ethereum, XRP, Dogecoin Lag: Analyst Sees Tests For BTC 'Definitely On The Cards' At This Level
crypto.description: Bitcoin gained, while other leading coins stagnated on Sunday, as the cryptocurrency market attempted a recovery after a rout earlier in the week.

crypto.title: Vulnerable and Worth Attacking
crypto.description: Only 10,230 Bitcoin, worth $719 million, is quantum-vulnerable and worth attacking, crypto asset manager CoinShares said.

crypto.title: Takaichi Triumph: Japan’s record 56,000 Nikkei surge sends bitcoin to $72,000, gold past $5,000
crypto.description: Japanese mandate sparks surge in equities and safe havens.

crypto.title: Why Quantum Computing Isn’t a Serious Risk for Bitcoin Yet: CoinShares
crypto.description: New research says today’s quantum computers are far too weak to threaten Bitcoin’s cryptography, leaving the network years to prepare.

crypto.title: Drake makes a hefty $1 million wager in Bitcoin on the Patriots for Super Bowl 2026
crypto.description: Patriots fans beware, the Iceman cometh. No, we're not talking about his upcoming album.

crypto.title: Bitcoin bears could sleepwalk into a $8.65 billion trap as options max pain expiry nears $90,000
crypto.description: A single BTC options date has $8.65B in exposure, with max-pain at $90k. We explain what that means and why it can matter for spot.

crypto.title: Bitcoin ETF flow numbers are fundamentally broken and most traders are missing the specific sign of a crash
crypto.description: Bitcoin ETFs can look dire while a few tickers stay green. Here’s what micro-inflows usually mean, and when they matter.

commodities.title: Wall Street braces for more pain in the face of market rebound Friday
commodities.description: Recent action in the metals markets — gold, silver and copper — may also herald more violent price moves, JPMorgan said.

commodities.title: Precious metals, oil slide as global tensions ease; copper down
commodities.description: Prices of commodities, from silver and gold to crude oil and copper, dived on Thursday, as global tensions eased after a telephone call between the leaders of China and the United States, which is also set for talks with Iran this week.

commodities.title: ETF’s Jump Back into Silver & Gold Pushes through $5000! Will it last?
commodities.description: ETFs move back into silver as gold pushes through $5,000, with Phil Streible breaking down the price action on Metals Minute. Tune in before the bell.

commodities.title: ETF’s Jump Back into Silver & Gold Pushes through $5000! Will it last?
commodities.description: ETFs move back into silver as gold pushes through $5,000, with Phil Streible breaking down the price action on Metals Minute. Tune in before the bell.

commodities.title: Stocks, gold, and silver steady after overnight volatility
commodities.description: The center of the action in markets was again precious metals, where momentum suddenly halted after gold’s price roughly doubled in 12 months.

commodities.title: Gold and Silver Price Crashes Not a Moment to Buy the Dip, Pros Say
commodities.description: Gold and silver crashed on Friday, but analysts caution that the dramatic declines might not be a moment to buy the dip in the precious metals.

commodities.title: Commodities Slump Rattles Markets As Gold, Silver, Oil Sell-Off Deepens
commodities.description: Gold prices slid about 9% to their lowest level in more than two weeks, while silver fell more than 13% after both metals hit record highs last week.

commodities.title: Slump in commodities rattles global markets
commodities.description: Commodities markets slumped on Monday, led by deep losses in gold, silver, oil and industrial metals, as a selloff ​unleashed by President Donald Trump's choice of Kevin Warsh for the next U.S. Fed chair sent precious metals tumbling for a second session.
